Detailed Description

It is one object of this class that have the thread that do the real work in the modules.

It waits for packets from the reader (via the Queue::dequeueu()-method) and gives them to the dispatcher. The reply is handled by the dispatcher.

For a single processor setup: 

 *    +--------------+
 *    |    Reader    |
 *    +------+-------+
 *PacketQueue|
 *    +------v-------+
 *    |  JobThread   |
 *    +------+-------+
 *  Packet   |
 *    +------v-------+   Reply +--------------+
 *    | JobDispatcher+-------->|  SendQueue   |
 *    +----+----^----+         +--------------+
 *  Packet |    | Reply
 *    +----v----+----+
 *    | JobCourier   |
 *    +----+----^----+
 *  Packet |    | Reply
 *    +----v----+----+
 *    |  Processor   |
 *    +--------------+
 *

Example of a multi processor setup:

 *    +--------------+
 *    |    Reader    |
 *    +------+-------+
 *PacketQueue|
 *    +------v-------+
 *    |  JobThread   |
 *    +------+-------+
 *  Packet   |
 *    +------v----------------------------+ Reply +--------------+
 *    |        JobDispatcher              +------>|  SendQueue   |
 *    +----+----^---------------+----^----+       +--------------+
 *  Packet |    | Reply  Packet |    | Reply
 *    +----v----+----+     +----v----+----+
 *    | JobCourier   |     | JobCourier   |
 *    +----+----^----+     +----+----^----+
 *  Packet |    | Reply  Packet |    | Reply
 *    +----v----+----+     +----v----+----+
 *    |  Processor   |     |  Processor   |
 *    +--------------+     +--------------+
 *

Definition at line 95 of file JobThread.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

JobThread::JobThread (  ProcessorFactory &  factory,
uint32  nbrProcessors,
JobScheduler *  scheduler,
PacketQueue *  q,
QueuedPacketSender::SendQueue &  sendQueue,
bool  verbose = false,
const Vector *  tcpPacketTypes = NULL
) 
 

Creates a JobThread with multiple processors.

Parameters:
factory Creates processors.
nbrProcessors Maximum number of processors.
scheduler Schedules couriers, if NULL a FIFO scheduler will be used.
q Incoming packets.
sendQueue Outgoing reply packets.
verbose Whether to give more debug output.
tcpPacketTypes Contains packet types that should always be sent via TCP.

JobThread::JobThread (  Processor *  processor,
PacketQueue *  q,
QueuedPacketSender::SendQueue &  sendQueue,
bool  verbose = false,
const Vector *  tcpPacketTypes = NULL
) 
 

Create a new job thread that uses a given processor to do the actual caluculations.

Parameters:
processor The processor that is used to calculate the reply.
q Queue used to get the packets. The dequeue method in the Queue must be hanging!
pp Optional parameter that if set is a packetpool that is used to store the packets (instead of "new" and "delete").
verbose Optional parameter that, if set to true, give a more verbose output.
tcpPacketTypes Optional parameter containing packettypes that should always be sent via TCP.

virtual JobThread::~JobThread (   )  [virtual]
 

Delete this job thread and release the allocated memory.

Member Function Documentation

void JobThread::processPacket (  Packet *  packet  ) 
 

Send the packet to a courier to be processed.

Caution: Use this only before the thread is running, if its used outside this instance.

Parameters:
packet Will be deleted by this.

virtual void JobThread::run (   )  [virtual]
 

The method that is executed when this method is started.

This must not be called explicit (used internally by the JTC-packet).

Reimplemented from ISABThread.
